```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(extrafont)
# font_import()
loadfonts(device = "win")

library(exactextractr)
library(osmdata)
library(sf)
library(terra)
library(tidyverse)
library(tmap)

tmap_mode("view")
```

## Get Data

```{r}
# Get Leuven roads from OSM

query <- getbb("Leuven, Belgium") %>% 
   opq() %>% 
   add_osm_feature("building") %>% 
   osmdata_sf()

leuBuildings <- query$osm_polygons

```

```{r}
# Load in population data saved from WorlPop: https://www.worldpop.org/geodata/summary?id=49938 and convert it to an sf object

belPop <- rast(here::here("2021/data/rawData/bel_ppp_2020_UNadj_constrained.tif"))

```

## Wrangle Data

```{r}
leuBuildings <- leuBuildings %>% 
  select(osm_id, geometry) %>% 
  st_transform(3857)
```

```{r}
# Now, I want a minimum bounding box

leuBound <- leuBuildings %>% 
  st_bbox() %>% 
  st_as_sfc()

mapBound <- leuBound %>% 
  st_centroid() %>% 
  st_buffer(4000,
            endCapStyle = "SQUARE")

mapLimit <- leuBound %>% 
  st_centroid() %>% 
  st_buffer(4500,
            endCapStyle = "SQUARE")

leuBound %>% 
  st_centroid() %>% 
  st_buffer(4500,
            endCapStyle = "SQUARE") %>% 
  tm_shape() +
  tm_dots() +
  tm_borders()
```

```{r}
leuBuildingsFilter <- leuBuildings %>% 
  st_intersection(mapBound)
```

```{r}
# Extract population for this area

leuPop <- exact_extract(belPop, 
                        leuBuildingsFilter, 
                        'sum', 
                        progress = F)
```

```{r}
# Add population back to buildings

leuBuildingsFilter$population <- leuPop
```

```{r}
# See the spread of the population

leuBuildingsFilter %>% 
ggplot(aes(x = population)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  xlim(0, 15)
```

## Build Map

```{r}
# Build the base layer

vizBase <- tm_shape(mapLimit) +
  tm_fill(col = "#f1eee9") +
  tm_shape(mapBound) +
  tm_fill(col = "#f1eee9") +
  tm_layout(bg.color = "#f1eee9",
            frame = F,
            frame.lwd = NA,
            attr.outside = F,
            outer.margins = 0,
            asp = 0,
            scale = 0.8,
            main.title = "Population Distribution*",
            main.title.color = "#000000",
            main.title.size = 1.75,
            main.title.fontfamily = "Arial Narrow",
            main.title.fontface = 2,
            main.title.position = "center",
            title = "Leuven",
            title.color = "#000000",
            title.size = 1.25,
            title.position = c("center", "TOP"),
            title.fontface = 2,
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            legend.title.color = "#f1eee9") + 
  tm_credits("#30DayMapChallenge | Day 12 | Anirudh Govind | Nov 2021 | Map data Â© OpenStreetMap contributors and available from https://www.openstreetmap.org\nBondarenko M., Kerr D., Sorichetta A., and Tatem, A.J. 2020. Census/projection-disaggregated gridded population datasets, adjusted to match the corresponding UNPD 2020 estimates,\nfor 183 countries in 2020 using Built-Settlement Growth Model (BSGM) outputs. WorldPop, University of Southampton, UK. doi:10.5258/SOTON/WP00685",
             col = "#000000",
             size = 1,
             position = c("left", "bottom"),
             fontfamily = "Arial Narrow")
```

```{r}
# Build the population layer

myPalette <- c("#fc9272",
               "#fb6a4a",
               "#ef3b2c",
               "#cb181d",
               "#a50f15",
               "#67000d")

vizPop <- tm_shape(leuBuildingsFilter) +
  tm_fill(col = "population",
          palette = myPalette,
          legend.show = T,
          breaks = c(0,
                     3,
                     6,
                     9,
                     12,
                     15)) +
  tm_lines(col = "#000000",
           lwd = 0.1)
```

```{r}
# Combine layers

viz <- vizBase + 
  vizPop
```

## Export

```{r}
# Export the map as an image to upload onto twitter

tmap_save(tm = viz,
          filename = here::here("2021/exports/Day12.png"),
          dpi = 450,
          width = 200,
          height = 200,
          units = "mm")

```
